item.title: Compounders, Deep Value and WildBrain
item.description: Compounders When we talk about compounders in the investment realm, we usually mean high quality companies that can consistently compound shareholder wealth at a superior rate over the long-term (from a Morgan Stanley article). From the article: The key financial characteristic of compounders is that they enjoy sustainable, high return on invested capital (ROIC). In other words, a compounder can be recognized or detected ex-post by looking at its ROIC, which leads to increased book value overtime, etc.

item.title: WildBrain
item.description: Disclaimer: I own shares of this company. None of this is investment advice. I do not know your particular situation and I am not qualified to give you advice. Please do your own due diligence. This will probably be the first in a series of posts on WildBrain. My goal here is just to give a taste of what I like about the company, but there’s much more to the story.
